message.content:
A pear is a type of fruit that belongs to the Rosaceae family. 
It has a round and elongated shape with a wider bottom and narrower top. 
The skin of a pear is typically green or yellow, although some varieties turn reddish-brown as they ripen. 
The texture of a pear is smooth and firm when picked, but it becomes softer and juicier as it ripens. 
The inside of a pear features soft, white flesh and a small core of seeds in the center. 
Pears are often used in cooking and baking, as well as eaten fresh as a snack. 
They can be found in grocery stores and at farmers' markets around the world.
